alert.note: Alert for Craven (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 30 at 2:05PM EDT until further notice by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Swift Creek Near Streets Ferry affecting Craven County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swift Creek Near Streets Ferry. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.5 feet, Water inundates portions of Streets Ferry Road, and it is likely impassable leading up to the bridge into the town of Vanceboro. Water also threatens a few homes along Streets Ferry Road just south of the creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM EDT Friday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 4.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 4.2 feet on 10/28/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued late tonight by 515 AM EDT.
